Event.name: Come_together
Event.definition: <def-root>In this frame a group of <fen>Individuals</fen> meet to form a <fen>Configuration</fen>. The <fen>Individuals</fen> or the <fen>Configuration</fen> may be expressed as the external argument of the predicates in this frame. In this frame, it is ambiguous whether or not the <fen>Individuals</fen> intentionally come together. In an alternative construal, a grammatically more prominent <fen>Party_1</fen> congregates with a <fen>Party_2</fen>, expressed as an oblique phrase. If this asymmetric construal is chosen, <fen>Purpose</fen> relates only to <fen>Party_1</fen>. <ex></ex> The congregating happens in a certain <fen>Place</fen> and at a certain <fen>Time</fen>. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Configuration">The crowd</fex> <t>came together</t> <fex name="Place">in the courtyard</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Individuals">The architects</fex> <t>amassed</t> <fex name="Place">in the lobby</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Configuration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Configuration</fen> describes the resulting formation of the individuals. <ex><fex name="con">The crowd</fex> <t>gathered</t> <fex name="Place">on the streets of Paris</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> descibes the way in which the <fen>Individuals</fen> accomplish the congregating.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>An action that the <fen>Configuration</fen> plans to engage in upon assembly.</def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The position in a series of iterations that the current congregating event occupies .
<ex>The group <t>came</t> <t>together</t> <fex name="Iterations">the first time</fex> in 1984.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>How often the <fen>Individuals</fen> come together to form an <fen>Configuration</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of congregating which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Individuals</fen> or <fen>Configuration</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex>Retired Sainsbury employees <t>came</t> <t>together</t> <fex name="Manner">in grand style</fex> in March and April to reminisce and share afternoon tea in the sumptuous surroundings of the Royal Lancaster Hotel .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Topic
Arg.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Topic</fen> of a discussion that may occur between the <fen>Individuals</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Party_1
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Party_1</fen> is the grammatically more prominent participant in the congregating event.
<ex><fex name="pa1">Our group</fex> <t>met</t> with theirs in the plaza.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Party_2
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A grammatically less prominent participant in the congregating event.
<ex>Our group <t>met</t> <fex name="pa2">with theirs</fex> in the plaza.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. </def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: gang together.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: form a group or gang

lexUnit.name: band together.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: people get together to form a group with a single identity

lexUnit.name: throng.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: flock or be present in great numbers.

lexUnit.name: meet.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to come into the company of, come together with, possibly unintentionally

lexUnit.name: amass.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: group together in large number.

lexUnit.name: congregate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to come together, especially in large numbers

lexUnit.name: band.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to form a specified configuration

lexUnit.name: assemble.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to come together to form a group

lexUnit.name: convene.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to come together to form a group
